sections.content: Salesforce is a cloud-based Customer Relationship Management (CRM) platform that provides a suite of tools and services for managing customer interactions, automating business processes, and building custom applications.

items: Multi-tenancy: Single instance serves multiple customers ("tenants") with data isolation
Metadata-driven architecture: Configuration stored as metadata
PaaS offerings: Heroku, Lightning Platform for custom app development
Declarative development: Build with clicks, not just code

sections.content: A technology company uses Salesforce to track customer interactions across email, phone, and chat, manage their sales pipeline with Opportunities, automate marketing campaigns with Pardot integration, and build custom apps for their field service technicians.
Understanding the Salesforce user interface and navigation patterns is essential for effective development and administration.

items: App Launcher: Central hub for accessing all apps and items
Setup Menu: Configuration center (accessed via gear icon)
Lightning Experience: Modern Salesforce UI interface
